data.title: Angel Blue
data.meta_description: Angel Blue is the ninth track on Green Day's ninth album and the start of the special trilogy, ¡Uno! data.text:
Angel Blue is the ninth track on Green Day's ninth album and the start of the special trilogy, ¡Uno!

Song Meaning[]

The narrator is in the middle of the relationship that he believes is falling apart. He wants to makes his girlfriend feel good but instead feels like a detriment to the relationship. However, the girlfriend continues to stand by his side, and both still find each other fun and compatible, despite being polar opposites. Even though the author struggles to balance his personal life and relationship, he'll do his best to take care of her.

Lyrics[]

[Verse 1]

Gotta build it up just to burn it down

You're the princess, I'm a fucking clown

Stop the presses, 'cause I'm killing time

Won't you be my bloody valentine?

[Chorus 1]

You're just a fucking kid, and no one ever gives you a break

You want a señorita, and now your heart is gonna break

You're Angel Blue, with teenage traces

Angel Blue, with pretty faces

[Verse 2]

Stab my heart like a stick in the mud

Cut my chest just to see the blood

Now I'm singing out the alphabet

As my tears are putting out my cigarette

[Chorus 2]

We'll hit the cemetery so we can see the holiday lights

Waking up the dead and everything'll be alright

You're Angel Blue with teenage traces

Angel Blue with pretty faces

[Guitar Solo]

[Bridge]

Alright, stuck in the middle of heaven and hell

Alright, trying to find my better angels

[Verse 3]

Stab my heart like a stick in the mud

Cut my chest just to see the blood

Stop the presses cause I'm killing time

Won't you be my bloody valentine?
